intro: Pasania tenuinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined pasania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with prominently visible veins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Pasania tenuinervis is often found in open woodland and along forest edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
